intro: Manilkara riedleana, commonly known as the Riedel's chicle tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by round, green fruits containing a sticky, latex-rich pulp. Its latex has historically been used to make chewing gum and is also valued for its medicinal properties. The plant is often found in lowland rainforests and is an important component of the local ecosystem.
